title: [Small Mammals]
description: The cobalt-spotted leaper is housed in an airy habitat circumscribed by a sturdy fence that rises quite high into the air to prevent the powerful animal from escaping.  A low, rocky wall slopes southward to meet the jungle-like trees and vines that thrive in the moist earth.  Rocky ledges and slopes rise into peaks, forming a ridgeline to the north.

The cobalt-spotted leaper is housed in an airy habitat circumscribed by a sturdy fence that rises quite high into the air to prevent the powerful animal from escaping.  Rocky ledges and peaks, rising high in the north, slope down to the deep shadows cast by jungle-like trees and vines.
